FAQ.question: What is a Cadastral Map (Non-Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: A cadastral map is an authoritative map that shows exact parcel boundaries, plot numbers, and dimensions for non-agricultural properties such as residential and commercial plots.

FAQ.question: Why is the Cadastral Map important for non-agricultural properties?
FAQ.answer: It is used for property registration, layout approvals, construction planning, resolving boundary disputes, and verifying plot dimensions for transactions and loans.

FAQ.question: What details are needed to obtain a cadastral map?
FAQ.answer: Provide the district/region, taluk/ward, survey or plot number, sub-division (if any), and owner or property details.

FAQ.question: How long does it take to get the cadastral map?
FAQ.answer: If available digitally it can be downloaded instantly; otherwise it may take 1â€“3 working days depending on the survey/revenue office workload.

FAQ.question: What information does the cadastral map contain?
FAQ.answer: It includes plot boundaries, measurements, adjoining plots, plot identifiers (CTS/survey numbers), and survey reference marks used by surveyors and municipal authorities.
